messages.message: Hi team! How do I, a Tam, ship our latest dev exchange packages such as blueprint and Doceye, to the customer environment? All good with how to publish them once I have them - but need to know how i get them into a nice wee ibsol file

Good question, i think we do maintain a repo with all ibsolutions? cc:@Kerry
Also how do we ensure what a customer is licensed to use a particular ibsolution or not before we publish them to a customer?
You should be able to find all the packaged `.ibsolution` files for Dev Exchange and Marketplace solutions here: https://instabase.com/system/global/fs/Instabase%20Drive/Applications/Marketplace/All/
Please note that some solutions in the systems repo (link posted above^) might not be customer ready. We should maintain a document/confluence page. not sure if we do that already.
Nothing like that exists as far as I am aware of… :cry:
Can someone please confirm if IB Semantics 0.0.11 & doceye 0.0.8.4 are customer ready? (actually to be used by IB devs in customer env)
if IB devs are just using it, it should be fine to just run with those for now since they are the most recent versions of each.
might be a good idea to also give the caveat that they're beta right now
(or at least doceye is, I think Semantics is good to go)

getting to this late; everything Andy and Mohit mentioned is correct. @Aaron Vontell and @Hari are the owner of ib_semantics and doceye respectively. they can answer the questions of if those packages are customer ready. but yes overall we lack a process / a central location for customer-ready packages. we should start creating them
